content: The formula ∫ x, exp (-b * x^2) = sqrt (π / b) for positive b is very classical, and has a number of different proofs -- in the PR, I am doing the one with the polar change of coordinates. Fun fact: in mathlib, this formula holds for any b regardless of its sign (because the real part of exp(i π / 2) is 0...).
I don't think that pr number is right
